content.webTitle: Have you had a legal battle with your council over SEN funding?

fields.headline: Have you had a legal battle with your council over SEN funding?
fields.bodyText: Budget cuts to education and local authorities have seen funding for children with special educational needs fall dramatically in recent years. Since 2015, funds for pupils with SEN have fallen by 17%, while those with less complex needs have been particularly affected. We’d like to speak to parents and guardians who have taken their local authority to a SEND tribunal to challenge a decision over a child’s Education Health and Care (EHC) plan or needs assessment. How to contribute We want to hear from people who have been part of a legal battle over SEND funding about the impact it’s had on their lives. Did you get the outcome you’d hoped for? Did you have to take time off work to try and secure extra support for your child? How has your child’s education and health been affected? To contribute, fill out the encrypted form below – only the Guardian will see your responses. Leave contact details if you can as one of our journalists may be in touch to discuss further.
